document.title: Introduction
document.paragraph:
../../../../../images/eiffelstudio/debugger/object_tool.png
The object tool is a debugging tool that displays extended dynamic information concerning one or several objects while debugging an application. This information includes the value of all their attributes, as well as the values of the once functions that have already been called. It is mainly composed of two grids (with tree view), the
05_local_view.xml local view and the
10_object_view.xml object view . In the toolbar are located two commands that facilitate browsing the trees: the
30_remove_object_command.xml remove object command
../../../../../images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_delete_very_small_color.gif and the
20_slice_size_command.xml set slice size command
../../../../../images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_slice_limits_vsmall_color.gif .
The third command
../../../../../images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_expand_string_color.gif can give an
25_expanded_display_tool.xml expanded display
of the string relative to an object, by dropping the object onto the button (or pressing Ctrl+E on the selected value). Use it if an object has a very long string representation or a string representation that contains carriage returns, for example.
And the last command
../../../../../images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_numeric_format_very_small_color.png switch the display of integer values between decimal and hexadecimal format.
By default, the object tool displays the full generating type for object, but this can be changed for speed concern in the ../70_debugger_preferences.xmlpreferences. The same way, through the ../70_debugger_preferences.xmlpreferences, the user can enable or disable the evaluation of the 17_debug_output.xmlDebug Output feature .
